````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 24 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder
### Command Line
You can also use the application from the command line by providing a source file as an argument:

````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 24 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder
### Command Line
You can also use the application from the command line by providing a source file as an argument:
````

A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing

### Prerequisites
- Java 17 or higher installed on your system

#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`

### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder

````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 17 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder
### Command Line
You can also use the application from the command line by providing a source file as an argument:

````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Quick Start
For the fastest way to get started, use the provided run scripts:
- **On Windows:** Double-click `run.bat` - **On Linux/Mac:** ``` chmod +x run.sh ./run.sh ```
For detailed installation instructions, see [INSTALL.md](INSTALL.md).
## Directory Structure
````

````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 17 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder

A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Quick Start
For the fastest way to get started, use the provided run scripts:
- **On Windows:** Double-click `run.bat` - **On Linux/Mac:** ``` chmod +x run.sh ./run.sh ```
For detailed installation instructions, see [INSTALL.md](INSTALL.md).

A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 17 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. ````markdown # Code to PDF Converter
A simple Java application that converts source code files to PDF with line numbers, line wrapping, and syntax highlighting.
## Features
- Convert source code files to beautifully formatted PDFs - Automatic line numbering - Smart line wrapping that preserves code readability - Syntax highlighting for multiple programming languages: - Java - Python - JavaScript - HTML - CSS - XML - C/C++ - And more... - Auto-detection of programming language based on file extension - Simple and intuitive graphical user interface - Support for drag and drop - Command-line usage for batch processing
## Installation
### Prerequisites
- Java 17 or higher installed on your system
### Installation Options
#### Option 1: Download the executable JAR
1. Download the latest `CodeToPdf-1.0.jar` from the releases page 2. Double-click the JAR file to run the application (on most systems)
#### Option 2: Build from source
1. Clone this repository 2. Navigate to the project directory 3. Build the project using Maven: ``` mvn clean package ``` 4. Find the executable JAR in the `target` directory: `target/codepdf-1.0.jar`
## Usage
### Graphical User Interface (GUI)
1. Launch the application by double-clicking the JAR file or running: ``` java -jar codepdf-1.0.jar ``` 2. Select a source code file using the "Browse" button or drag and drop a file onto the application window 3. Verify or change the output PDF file location 4. Optionally adjust settings like programming language 5. Click "Convert to PDF" to generate the PDF file 6. When conversion completes, you can open the PDF directly or access its containing folder
